info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued May 01 at 3:13PM PDT until May 02 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 PM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 6 inches, except 6 to 10 inches above 7000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph along Sierra ridges. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 11 PM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snowfall is expected Tuesday afternoon between 2 PM and 8 PM PDT.
info.instruction: Even light snowfall causes major travel delays, especially during periods of high traffic volume. Be sure to allow extra time to reach your destination. Leave extra space between vehicles since it takes longer to stop on slick roadways. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
